column1: The 8th District is home to so many great small businesses that I always enjoy visiting. Clearly Ohio’s response to COVID has hit small businesses especially hard this year. This #SmallBusinessSaturday please consider supporting small businesses in your area by shopping local. https://t.co/E1EtLvRs7d

I’m sure the journalists have been working hard to make this clear... #FactsMatter. https://t.co/vhh3v27A4E

Enjoyed today's conversations and questions about the election and the federal response to #coronavirus. https://t.co/HcWaj38G4Z
#GoodNews “And the research squares with another recent finding: that survivors of SARS caused by another coronavirus still carry certain important immune cells 17 years after recovering.”

Statistics never rival personal tragedies. We should all be mindful that more than 236000 Americans have died w/ #COVID19. We should also fight the battle we’re actually in; not the one many originally feared (+2-million deaths) or the one that we all hoped for (already gone).

A reminder... According to CDC if you happen to get #COVID19 the survival rate by age is overwhelming: 0-19 99.997% 20-49 99.9% 50-69 99.5% +70 94.6% The fatality risk is heavily tied to  comorbidities which is a major factor in the +70 year old data.

#FactsMatter It is long overdue for governors and public health officials to fight the battle we’re actually in rather than the wildly inaccurate #COVID19 projections. By reacting to actual data the truly vulnerable can be more safe & America more free.  https://t.co/ZIBju1UJOf

Abortion kills more than 4x as many people per year as COVID19. Think.. what if our country worked to prevent the spread of abortion as earnestly as this year’s reaction to COVID19. https://t.co/TJZNiPeCU0

Suddenly the House has time to consider invoking the #25thAmendment--less than a month before the election--but not time to have bipartisan negotiations for responsible #COVID relief? A purely political move from the Speaker. https://t.co/RJvuMjih7u

State budgets have taken a hit throughout t he #COVID19 pandemic. My Flexibility for States and Localities Act would make better use of #CARES funds by giving states and counties greater discretion to fill gaps in their budgets. https://t.co/fL9tN74MUO
#COVIDfacts > #COVIDfear Ohio has 34 fatalities per 100000 people - that’s 0.034%. For comparison: https://t.co/TDXDUXkUYt

Governors & city councils can and should take steps to protect citizens from #COVID19. However it's possible to do that while still respecting our constitutional rights. My Defending Freedom Act will ensure that is the case. Read my latest in @dcexaminer: https://t.co/IV7fOKmrga
Today I introduced the Defending Freedom Act to ensure Americans’ freedoms are protected during the #COVID19 pandemic.
COVID facts > COVID fear

The need for the Flexibility for States and Localities Act will become more apparent as governments look at their balance sheets. Budgets took a hit as a result of #COVID19.  We should empower states to use the money they already have more effectively. https://t.co/bdNWFs9I7u
My Flexibility for States and Localities Act will ensure we make efficient use of #CARESAct funding before spending more on #COVID19 relief. #DontBankruptAmerica! https://t.co/1116rds1dC

To be certain #CoronaVirus will disrupt our long economic expansion with supply & demand shocks - especially trade with China... But most employers still feel their limit on growth is workforce. Those fundamentals offer the potential to sustain our strong & growing economy.

Financial markets are far more volatile than the fundamental economy. While many financials panic low oil prices will be great for consumers and an opportunity for many. The Fed continues to grow its balance sheet injecting liquidity into repo... And that predates #CoronaVirus

The federal agencies responsible for public health responses are ready and able to respond to #COVID19. In fact since 2015 there has been an appreciable increase in funding of the @NIH & the @CDCgov. #coronavirus https://t.co/58IYLwE4Ro

.@Surgeon_General advises against the general public wearing face masks to prevent contracting #coronavirus: they aren't proven to protect the general population and medical staff need them.  But the @CDC has good advice to limit the spread of #COVID19 and other viruses. https://t.co/mngOqOJhCR
